text: I awoke to the bedside serenade you played on the accordion. I thought that was my cue to head home then noticed the shackle around my ankle
I taught my dog to talk. I made him my wingman and went out to pick up women, but he answered honestly when asked if I was worth dating.
The words spilled unexpectedly from your lips, landing on my chest where they seeped in. My auto response system engaged. "I love you, too"
Saw my enemy from 9th grade, Ted Nedland, walking on the road. I lunged the car forward. "Look out!" yelled my wife. No time to explain.
I cooked a special meal for our date, but Adele screamed when I put the fish on her plate. Apparently mermaids don't eat their friends.
I fed the King another story for his pleasure. It was his opium. He lived in my words, while outside, his defeated kingdom crumbled.
I attached the transmitter to my daughter's skull. As I suspected, her thoughts were not all sugar and spice and everything nice.
I chose an alternate path. I avoided, love, work, wealth, fame. I sought knowledge, lived among library books, devoured them, one by one.
After a big fight about me being messy, Kim and I broke up. With no funds to get a place of my own, we both continued living in her car.
I met Mary in the grocery store. She smiled at me and I fell in love instantly, missing the red flag that she was wearing only one shoe.
I shoved another cookie in your petite mouth as you struggled against the handcuffs. This time, I wouldn't be the fat bridesmaid.
"You're too beautiful to be real" "I'm here" she said. Then I heard my wife coming home. I watched Tess quickly step back into the painting.
Carl was good at small things like buttering toast or stacking neatly. It was big things like talking to people that gave him trouble.
Martin misspelled a word on Twitter. The grammar sharks circled and he battled relentlessly, needing a distraction from his broken heart.
Mark chose a fish as his pet. A single lonely goldfish, isolated from the rest of the world, just like him.
Lovemaking with the mime was awkward. From what I could tell, she wanted me to pleasure her by riding a bicycle or hiding behind a wall.
He toyed with their emotions, seeing if he could make them feel something. He lived through them now. His own heart closed a long time ago.
Walter sat staring at the screen. Melissa's IM invited him to coffee. He paused for a moment then pushed delete. Walter preferred tea.
On the prowl at the retirement home, David leaned on the candy machine. Doris would come for her Snickers, but he would sell her on love.
It’s not easy being Fate. I'm overworked. So many things to decide for people. Sometimes I take a break and just let things happen randomly.
The shared hashtags. The late night tweets. Direct messages. I thought we were in love. How could she unfollow me?
He loved her through her multitude of boyfriends always hoping she'd come to her senses and love him. Finally, he settled for her sister.
4am. You are asleep again. I am awake. I am making a tape of you snoring. I will use this in court when I plead insanity.
Allen dropped the needle into the groove. Marching music played loudly. He started to feel better. Five minutes till the next patient.
Home early from work. Found you in the tub. Candles and bubbles. Undressed to join you. Noticed the two champagne glasses, already empty
”The view is beautiful.“ thought Steve, seeing the trees and hills. ”I never noticed.“ Long deep breath. He climbed in from the ledge.
Levi was very proud of his mustache. He drew a sense of power from it. Now the two of them lived alone. Lana didn’t want a threesome.
Ernie stared at the pile of papers on his desk. What to keep? What to throw away? Why did the teacher let his kid make so much art?
Saw myself coming out of the pharmacy the other day. Wondered what I had. Somethings better not to know. Better go back to my own time.
Officer Ryan just missed the ledge as he leapt across buildings while pursuing the suspect. Thinking as he fell, "I hate mondays."
Troy sat down and faced the four dozen donuts. He wrote one of his problems on each donut, then ate them, making his problems disappear .
"God, help me," Doug cried. The sky opened up, God reached down and plucked him up. Part of the new personalized customer service plan.
Jim and Stella shredded their relationship in the lobby. Screaming about never seeing each other but joined by the last available room.
The catapult launched Tom towards Kim's window. He crashed through with the banner proclaiming his love. She, however, was at the pool.
Afterwards, Dylan laid his head on the pleasure bot's chest. He tried not to cry. He had paid for sex but what he needed was a cuddle.
Darla snuggled Rick on the plane, headed for a second honeymoon. Things had changed since her coma, she'd forgotten all about his affairs.
Jacques spent his life working with wood. No time for family. Now, on his death bed, his figurines gather round, to bid him farewell.
I could tell by her fur she wasn't from around here. We chit chatted. I put on the moves. We went to my place. In the Spring, we had cubs.
First date with HotGinger142 tonight. I hide my soul under the bed. Things I do with people I meet online, I don’t want my soul to see.
Zara woke up to find the severed head of a pink My Little Pony in her bed. The message was clear. She returned her brother's GI Joe.
I fell in love with Georgette the first time she whispered in my ear. Her body was all woman but she had the mind of a truck driver.
Joan just lay there, waiting for Bert to finish. It seemed to be taking a long time. How long could an 85 year old millionaire live?
”You want to hold hands?“ said Bill. ”Umm.......Ok.“ said Ken. They both needed a little comfort. It had been a tough staff meeting.
Karen wears the pants in the family. Larry does what he is told. First he got the vasectomy he didn’t want. Now, it was the lobotomy
Wendel showered and took a Viagra. He lit the candles and turned back the sheets. Marge had cancelled but he could still have a good time.
At the singles bar I transformed into a unicorn to impress the women, but neglected to consider the inadequate size of my horn.
The wind pushed me off the cliff. For a moment, I felt like I was flying. My problems all floated away, until reality came crashing up.
Disguised as the Devil, I tested you by tempting you with wealth, power, and fame before approving your application to marry me.
“Hi, I’m Rick. I’m a writer.” “Hi Rick,” everyone said. “It’s been 3 days since I’ve written.” Everyone clapped to celebrate my sobriety.
I was in orbit around Sandra. The pull of her bright smile and long legs drew me in. It was inevitable I would crash land on her surface.
I asked Marjorie out. She handed me a pamphlet about the risks and side effects of dating her. Not much of a reader, I took too large a dose
"I Love you." "I don't believe you. It doesn't sound like you mean it." "I LOVE you." "That's better." "OK, then put the knife down."
Ready for battle, I taunted Monday and spit in its face, but when I woke up from my drunken haze, I realized I'd been yelling at Sunday.
Psst! It's me...I mean you, from the future. Don't worry, it works out. You'll be wrongly convicted but meet your true love in prison.
I hid in the in-between, the time/space between my cubicle and the meeting rooms. Always moving, never stopping anywhere I could be fired.
Craig reached for his pen but it wasn’t there. He ran home holding his head, trying to keep the idea from seeping out.
Barry looked at the empty side of the bed, finally realizing no one was coming to complete his life. This was it. Time to start living
Walter loved Jillian, the librarian. He longed to sort her stacks, turn her pages. But they were shelved apart, classics and new releases.
4am. You are asleep. I am awake. I am writing love notes on your back. They will give you the nudge you need to tell your boyfriend about us
You have such an intriguing mind and such interesting thoughts. I wonder where they come from she said, holding my brain up to the light.
I woke to a pack of wolves in the kitchen, howling at the fridge. I fed them frozen waffles and one by one they turned back into my children
Darla likes working. It's her best skill. When not working she doesn’t know what to do. To fill her free time she got a second job.
I switched on my anti-gravity boots in an effort to escape your overbearing ways, but you fired a harpoon of guilt that prevented my ascent.
Noticed her legs first. Strong and lean. Long scar on the back of one. I took my time approaching. Kissed her on the nose. Great horse.
After you broke up with me, I got a call from imaginary you. She's not afraid of commitment or my family. We're getting married in the fall.
I tried to reach you in your dimension but couldn't find the door. Trapped in parallel lives as roommates, I longed to kiss and touch you.
The medication didn't work. The happy thoughts continued. Unable to find the blackness, my days as an artist ended. I joined the normals.
Cupid came to help. He drew his bow and fired an arrow at Raina, but his aim was low. I was forever in love with her feet.
The desk knew my secrets, 30 years of business dealings and a secretary or two. Now I was retiring. I burned it to guarantee its silence.
Marrying a robot wife was the answer to my loneliness, until I woke to an empty bed and find her cuddling the refrigerator.
Dissatisfied with the automatic submission system, I manually submitted you to the afterlife, ending your suffering and mine.
"You're too beautiful to be real" "I'm here" she said. Then I heard my wife coming home. I watched Tess quickly step back into the painting.
Your face looked familiar. I searched my mind for your name but had to settle for saying "Good morning" when you awoke next to me in the bed
"We're out of Perfect Life. We have some Simple Life left." "Hmm, I'll take the Work Constantly, Make Money, Die Alone. I had it last time."
I lived fast and loose until the emotional debt collector knocked on my door and made me pay up for all the hearts I'd broken along the way.
I turned on the light to help you find your way, wanting you to feel safe on your journey. So many find it unsettling here in the afterlife.
I wrote "I love you" a thousand times on the walls, but you were too deep in a romance novel to notice I wanted to be more than roommates.
I used my authority as mayor to cancel your passport. Given enough time here, you would learn to love me and life on the moon.
Before his date with Sara, Duane drenched himself with cologne to cover up the fact he'd become one of the undead over the weekend.
Your eyes were a different color when we awoke. I knew you'd been replaced. Considered my options and played along. New you was good in bed.
Martha snuggled up to Rick. He smelled so good. So many questions she wanted to ask about his life. It made her wish he was still alive.
Mona softly opened the door and turned on her flashlight. He was sleeping. She couldn’t get her dignity back but she could get her money.
Clowning was Daryl's profession, cooking was his passion. Stella thought he was perfect. She liked to laugh and never learned to cook.
Paul was frugal. Every day for lunch it was plain turkey on dry whole wheat. Today was his birthday. He allowed himself mustard.
The coin dropped into the slot and that sweet feeling returned. My problems faded. I am powerful. You cannot stop me. I AM Ms. Pacman.
"Like a Sprite?” she said knowing it was my favorite. “Yes.” She put it on the bed just out of reach. I strained against the handcuffs.
Math has always been my favorite subject. I get along with numbers. They make sense. Numbers don’t lie. Why couldn’t she be a number?
Paul was running out of options. The world was closing in. His survival instinct did the only thing it could, blame someone else.
Nancy’s life felt like quicksand. No way to get out. She needed a rope or a branch or a hand. Her mother had given her an anvil.
"Firetruck!" yelled 5 year old Billy. His Mom had told him his Dad was a fireman. When he got older he set fires, hoping to meet Dad.
David likes to record. He documents each moment of his life. Photos, video, audio. He never watches any of it. Not even when it happened.
“Do you love me Phillip?” asked Pricilla. “That’s a silly question” he replied, still looking at his paper. “I thought so” she said.
I tried again with the same results. Disappointed, I dismantled the time machine I'd built. It was useless. It only traveled to Mondays.
I tied the end of a rope to a kitten then tossed him in my closet. The meowing stopped. I pulled back a frayed rope. Yep, something in there
Our last child moved out. Faced with just each other, we got reacquainted and I discovered I'd marry you again...in spite of the children.
You were sad, I could tell. I knew you liked comfort food so I made waffles. I covered the bed with them and you cuddled their warm goodness
What I most wanted was you. What I settled for was your sister..in your hand-me-down clothes, viewed from a good angle in low light.
I watched you build a bridge across the moat protecting my heart. When you crossed, I let the arrows fly, not realizing you were unarmed.
I lived inside the walls of the mall, eating food from the trash. I watched the shoppers and waited for Mom. She said she'd be right back.
I hid my tail from my dates. It was a family trait on my father's side, but not all women were as understanding as my mother had been.
I wrote a love letter, in chalk, on the sidewalk by your house, but the rain washed it away just as you arrived home with your boyfriend.
Do not worry my love. I shall come for you tonight. We shall steal away where we can be together forever. Lovingly yours, Death.
Paul crunched all of the bags of potato chips on the store shelves. If he couldn't eat them on his diet, neither would anyone else.
I slipped into your bed and cuddled you. I felt safe. I'd leave before morning, beg coins all day, then follow someone else home tomorrow.
Sometimes when I can not write, I wait for the happy thoughts to pass. When the darkness returns the words flow again and make their mark.
I want you to love me. said Edith, looking into his eyes. The Devil hesitated, calculating how to come out ahead on this deal.
You asked for flowers and I brought flowers. You asked for dancing and I danced. I asked for your love and you gave back the flowers.
I am laying in the sun looking at clouds. That puffy one looks like you. ”Phil?“ I say. No answer. I guess were still not speaking.
Karen lay back on the piano, inviting Kyle to have her. Unaware, he continued to discuss the nuances of Bach and how they excited him.
John was boss of chocolate cake. He made it do his bidding. Each bite was forced to leap into his mouth. He was in charge now, not Mom
The helicopter lifted off. Mike looked down at Cindy, growing smaller as the fires closed in. Afraid of heights, she had stayed behind.
Momentary serenity. Sitting on the bottom of the pool, a brief vacation from the world. Soon, they will find me. My kids always do.
After losing his job, Nigel lived without caution. Even when the forecast called for rain, he refused to carry an umbrella.
"Do you ever wish you had married someone else?" asked Gina. Albert's brain went into overdrive seeking the correct answer. "No?"
I used my second wish to undo the first. Your body sprang back to life. The third wish I'm keeping, in case you get out of line again.
I locked the bedroom door but Monday slipped in through the keyhole and dragged me from the bed. Where is my friend Friday when I need him?
My father came to live with me. It was my turn to say "my house, my rules". I took away his glass and made him drink from the milk carton.
Guys night out started as a party, but turned into a cry fest as we all went on about how much we loved our wives.
I developed a drug that numbed the pain of being stuck in traffic, but something went wrong, people started creating gridlock for pleasure.
I resent Anger Management class. I don't have a problem. I wasn't angry when I pushed you out in front of the bus. I just don't like you.
It never really seemed right killing perfect strangers, but having come from a small family, I had run out of options.
I pried the tracking chip out of my arm. It made me too easy to find. If you took the time to find me now, I'd know you really loved me.
Perfect for each other, they lived a block apart, but would never meet. They lived in different worlds. His was Facebook, hers was Twitter.
By now you've realized your brakes don't work. I'm sorry. I'm not very good at goodbyes and thought this would be easier for both of us.
My imaginary friend Jess and I had always been close, but as I grew older my mind became weighted by reality and she no longer came to play.
I found an old photograph of us while cleaning out the attic. We looked so happy together then. It made me want to dig you up and apologize.
I missed you, I said. You laid there, still and quiet. I took up my pen and dragged it across your pages. Suddenly we were one again.
The war between us finally ended when I forgave you, which concurred with the arrival of the letter announcing your long overdue death.
I snuggled up against sweet you, not wanting to say goodbye. The moment broken by the reverend's voice asking me climb out of your coffin.
My body broke down on the long journey. With no spare parts available, I discarded it and continued on my quest for enlightenment.
I ran out of water and knelt down in the heat. Lost and too tired to go on, I let the ants carry me away, piece by piece, to their queen.
Noticed her legs first. Strong and lean. Long scar on the back of one. I took my time approaching. Kissed her on the nose. Great horse.
One. Two. Three. Jump. Seems easy, but I'm still here on our ledge...hesitating. Maybe you are working late this time...and not out with him
I found you in a tent on the beach and handcuffed us together while you slept, making sure you wouldn't abandon me the the way you did Mom.
4am. You are asleep again. I am awake. I am making a tape of you snoring. I will use this in court when I plead insanity.
The playful pictures of puppies and kittens posted by the chair helped brighten my clients minds as I performed my duties as executioner.
I hurled the porcupine towards you, hoping that it would hurt as much as the cold prickly insult you had fired through my defenses.
Rebecca reached into my dream and slayed the demons attacking me. I protected her in this world and she watched over me in all of the others
Some people get things bronzed, I had my 1st wife encased in gold. I really liked her. I won't let one indiscretion tarnish her memory.
On his 50th birthday, Phil saddled a giraffe and rode through town. His wife waited patiently as he reclaimed the dreams of his youth.
I hit bottom when the circus fired me for drinking too much. Alone and miserable, I went where unwanted clowns go, the rodeo.
Mark's foot had swollen to twice it's normal size. His health insurance company was sympathetic, they sent him larger shoes.
You haven't seen Mr. Potato Head in days? "That's right, detective" said his wife. "You want to explain the tater tots in the oven?"
It's huge, It won't fit she said. "Let's try" I coaxed. "Umm..OK, but go slow." She was right, my yacht destroyed her slip.
Kim walked down the aisle. Suddenly, she saw herself burst into the room. ñStop! DonÍt marry Phil! YouÍll learn to love yourself!î
I took the gun from her lifeless hand, aimed, and pulled the trigger. I loved her. She deserved more than to be listed as a suicide.
Dave wrote the world's most perfect story. He rushed it to his publisher, who read it and said "It's 150 characters, it's useless."
I lay in the dirt, my friends shouting "Get up, Danny!" but this was for my sister, she'd finally stood up to me. The victory was hers.
Gerald challenged me to fisticuffs and I accepted. The winner to get Mary. He approached and I, not fully understanding the rules, shot him.
The dissection didn't go as planned. Mary displayed the symptoms, but we could find no physical evidence of the Devil inside her.
The cougar paced the conference room, a reminder that business was an unpredictable animal that could eat you at any time.
I practiced each conversation beforehand on the holodeck. It was the secret to dealing with my wife's seemingly unpredictable moods.
A rare moment. None of the children were screaming, nothing to rush to, money in the bank. He remembered, for an instant, he loved her
There you were, walking along, holding hands with our minister, Rick. Just weeks after the children and I, said goodbye to your ashes.
Dear Chocolate Cake, Last night was special. I've never been kissed like that. You're the one. Hope you feel the same. Check yes or no.
As we walked into the darkness, I let go of your hand. Watching from afar, as you continued the descent, into your own personal hell.
Rex was a tampon in Debbie's world, blocking her flow of life. He tried to make life safe. She wanted to leap across the jaws of death.
I really thought Patricia liked me for me, but when I saw the saddle on her bed, I knew she was just another woman with a jockey fetish.
I locked the bedroom door but Monday slipped in through the keyhole and dragged me from the bed. Where is my friend Friday when I need him?
It was you. Your kiss that injected me with this sickness. Your passionate, wet, slobbery, flu-ridden kiss. Let me return the favor.
I dated Sara, accepting her kids as my own. She disappeared after our wedding vows, leaving a note: "thanks for watching the kids".
Upset by the bad grade, Martin threw the homework across the classroom. He was put in timeout by Ms. Stein, his son's teacher.
I want you to know, you're the only thing that ever mattered to me, I said. "I know," whispered the bottle of Jack Daniels.
I clawed my way through Friday, determined to get to the weekend. At 5 o'clock, I ran out of work straight into the bus Death was driving.
I woke up as a sled dog in Alaska, having made my final wish in a drunken blackout, a result of the rum from wish #2.
It 's Friday!
Years later, sitting alone in his mansion, with no one to hold him, it finally hit him. "This is what she meant."
Jack threw a piece of candy on the floor and watched his 3 children fight for it. The winner was groomed to protect Jack as he grew old
I'd been living as Peter for years when I bumped into him. He was a mess, having no idea how to care for the female body I swapped him.
The TV learned to turn itself on. It watched the family in the room. They just sat there staring. The TV got bored and turned off forever
The surgeon removed my memories of you, healing my broken heart in the process... until I met you in a bar and the tragedy began again.
The party was over, they were alone at last. Bill acted on his sweet thoughts, but the maid walked in, as he mounted the birthday cake.
The panel thought I could bring some flair to the position. They offered me the job, but it would be up to me remove my predecessor, Death.
The leprechaun and I formed a partnership. He put up his pot of gold as collateral on my house loan and I winged for him at the singles bar.
The kids begged me and I gave in. A trip for 3 to the Moon. Much more expensive than when I was a kid. We used to just imagine going.
The drug suppressed fear. No longer afraid, I picked up girls, got clients, and danced in public, until I went walking in a lightning storm.
The darkness from the blindfold filled my head with thoughts of your embrace. My mind was with you. I didn't feel the bullets pierce my body
Ready for battle, I taunted Monday and spit in its face, but when I woke up from my drunken haze, I realized I'd been yelling at Sunday.
The bold strokes and bright colors clearly spoke that it was my creation, which lead them to my art studio, and my conviction for murder.
Steven poured the syrup over his scrambled eggs. He still allowed himself the fantasy of carbs as he made believe it was pancakes.
Shopping List: 2 sheep, 1 goat, 4 cows, large net, animal launcher, video camera, Book: how to post viral video
Seemed beautiful, naming our daughter, Ecstasy. Created from exactly that. When boys circled like sharks, we took to calling her Kate.
Rick's life changed when he had children. They became the light of his life. Now, if they would just shut up and eat their damn breakfast
Phil looked out at John, gasping for air on the Moon's surface. He turned away. Now, he would be captain, the position he deserved.
Not one to follow directions, Jack snorted the magic beans. That's when his troubles started.
I met Barb in a coffee shop, she sat in the back reading palms. I held mine out. She gasped, sensing she'd be my next sacrifice.
My heart leapt when I saw the star tattoo on your face matching mine. I'd found you, my pre-arranged marriage partner chosen by the state.
I went to see Marie off on her voyage. She never even knew I was there, clinging to the outside of the rocket when it launched.
I watched you run down the field with the ball, knowing you only did it for the money, never letting the public see your true passion, dance
I took the jar down from the shelf, opened it, and spoke to my father's heart, telling him I loved him...finally conversing heart to heart.
I opened the window and looked at the moon. Your body was still there. The cameras had seen me do it, but no one had jurisdiction to try me.
Monday crept over Jack, killing his mood. The weekend had been great. He'd partied like there was no tomorrow, but unfortunately, there was.
I knew I was the only one who could stop me. Sad to see what I'd become, I shot my future self then traveled back and awaited the inevitable
Donald showered Lucy with affection & compliments but he was invisible to her. She was drawn to neglect, a product of boarding school.
Donald got up his nerve. He wanted to meet Vicky. A fumbled hello & a sweaty handshake. He smiled. She was the nervous one.
Do you think they're coming back? asked Julie. "No" I said, "They looked happy driving away." After that my sister and I raised ourselves.
Denise is afraid someone will see her. She tries to be invisible. ItÕs working. No one has come to her apartment in years.
Carla likes Roger but he doesnÕt like himself. Carla feeds him self esteem. Roger tells her she is wonderful. A symbiotic relationship.
As the newspaper lay alone in the driveway, it hatched a plan to save itself. Get an iphone and a twitter account, then they'd listen.
As a newcomer, I was devastated. The others tried to comfort me. "It's OK" "Happens to everyone" "At least you had clothes on when you died"
